alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 09 at 9:26AM MDT until April 09 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM UNTIL 9 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK, EXCEPT FROM 11 AM UNTIL 9 PM MDT FROM THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN EASTWARD, DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM UNTIL 8 PM MDT SUNDAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOW PACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT MONDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL MID EVENING FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WIND, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong west and southwest winds will combine with several hours of single digit minimum humidities, well above normal temperatures, and an unstable airmass to produce widespread critical fire weather conditions this afternoon. Ridgetop winds will strengthen tonight and combine with poor humidity recoveries to produce locally critical fire weather conditions through the overnight hours. Consequently, critical conditions are expected to develop rapidly Sunday morning in many areas. Warm, dry, windy, and unstable conditions are forecast to persist areawide through Monday, then through Tuesday east of the central mountain chain. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 8 PM MDT SUNDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Along and east of the central mountain chain below snowpack from late this morning until mid evening, then locally critical conditions will persist through tonight. Critical conditions rapidly redevelop Sunday morning and persist through early evening, then return Monday afternoon until mid evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph today, then locally up to 50 mph over ridgetops and favored east slope locations tonight. Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph Sunday. Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to around 50 mph Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Over 10 hours of single digit humidities today, then widespread poor humidity recovery tonight. Around 5 to 14 percent Sunday and Monday. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains
